flow.descriptionCdata:
e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.105ba468-3921-485b-9746-b3f04707ab50.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.19d2edc3-b2e7-4f50-9a8a-fef798f188f3.prompt=User Identifier e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.1a6a3d29-c749-43f0-9f91-420e121ef512.description=Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs. Input Parameters\: vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow templateName - name of the VM template to clone in vCenter osType - linux or windows host - vCenter host to execute against user - vCenter username password - vCenter password vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc) Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.346554f9-f9b1-436f-bf05-3ce06694ce1a.prompt=User Identifier e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.3c82261a-444a-43da-94a0-d09fdbda72f2.prompt=Process Instance ID e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.42fa007e-b935-464c-a8f1-eb896cf94f78.prompt=Process Instance ID e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.47bfe7ce-1871-4f98-b587-fe141e9f0fcf.prompt=User Identifier e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.5d376059-a26a-4a02-a4dc-0b1df36f5c85.prompt=Resource Provider ID e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.618d1244-90e3-444c-a8ec-95233c2e1419.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.61cd4064-5081-4400-90be-777e0cddecb4.prompt=Artifact ID e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.6a5326e9-4893-4d9d-97b6-9071e67ad58c.prompt=User Identifier e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.6e690883-8f44-439f-adef-639659b5b433.prompt=Component ID e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.b35d815f-87de-4c55-96a9-56efeb9cbfc6.prompt=User Identifier e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.b623bd63-e6a6-4b74-a029-43aa3915e5c3.description=This workflow adds/updates the component property using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing property (In this case input "valueType" is not required , This input will not be considered even if provided) no - To add/update property valueType - Value type of the property. It can have value from selection list "CSA-Property-ValueType". This Input is required only when Input "onlyUpdate" is selected as "no". values - One or more values dilimited by comma , (If user want to use some other separator for multiple values then needs to be pass as next input "separator") separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the values ( default dilimiter used is comma ,) e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.bfbe845b-f07b-41a9-ae14-bc384d7fff0a.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.ca4a7367-aedb-40bd-a2aa-2d514c22594b.prompt=Process Instance ID e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.description=
Stop the Virtual Machine

Inputs Parameters\:

 CSA_CONTEXT_ID – CSA Context Id
 CSA_PROCESS_ID – CSA Process Instance Id
 SVC_COMPONENT_ID - This token will resolve to the Service component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]
 RSC_PROVIDER_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Provider Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL - This token will resolve to the subscriber’s email address. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]
 RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Subscription Id that was created from the Resource Offering at the Subscription time.
  		Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE - This token will resolve to the Service component type. Eg\: Server.. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]
 RSC_POOL_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource pool Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_POOL_ID]
 SVC_INSTANCE_ID - This token will resolve to the Service Instance Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_INSTANCE_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Subscription Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 PRN_COMPONENT_ID – This token will resolve to the parent Component’s Service Component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: PRN_COMPONENT_ID]
 REQ_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_ORG_ID]
 REQ_USER_ID - This token will resolve to the User Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_USER_ID]
 USR_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the subscriber. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: USR_ORG_ID]
 RSC_BINDING_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Binding Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_BINDING_ID]

Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.ef077cbf-a36f-4b91-8b82-60f55a9f9d2d.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.fb19c7a3-ad3c-4cd6-b298-86a266638d47.prompt=User Identifier e6fd8985-fa16-4592-8dba-7168099b8e04.fc6bdddc-5380-4516-973e-ed8e78a62841.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State
flow.name: vCenter Stop Server
